results.title: The Hidden land
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and N.S. Thapa
results.brief_description: All along India’s northern frontier run the Himalayas, a formidable chain of snow-clad mountains and glacial valleys. Clothed in this cold and glittering mantle lies the kingdom of Bhutan, remote and mystic. This film is a study of this neighbouring kingdom, its people and their art and culture. Narrated by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and N.S. Thapa

results.title: The Hidden grievance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plant Supervisors Problems”.
Part of a six film series dramatising case problems met within industry. This film helps to make supervisors aware of the need for sensitivity in recognising and understanding underlying causes of an employee grievance in order to handle it satisfactorily.

results.title: The Hidden factor
results.creator_credit: Norman Laird, Tasmanian Government Film Unit and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Alcohol in road accidents. The effect of alcohol and self-control; medical opinion estimates that the official figures on road accidents greatly underestimate the role of alcohol; the need for a scientific standard of intoxication; how the blood test helps police and protects passengers and others on the road; how the carelessness induced by alcohol frequently ends in tragedy. The story follows several people who combine drinking with driving.

results.title: The Hidden curriculum: attitudes
results.brief_description: One of a group of films about sex role stereotyping in schools. Examines the response of students and teachers to a female principal, and her own attitudes to her position. No other credits available.

results.title: The Hickory stick
results.creator_credit: National Education Association, Mental Health Film Board and Irving Jacoby
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how a fifth grade teacher maintains an orderly atmosphere for learning and at the same time helps her youngsters cope with their behaviour and learning problems. Shows how she uses firmness and understanding in helping children to control their feelings and accept authority.

results.title: The Hero as an artist; Protest and communication
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Michael Gill and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 5 and 6 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 5. Michelangelo, Raphael and Leonardo da Vinci are featured in this program which centres on Papal Rome in the early 16th century. Sir Kenneth Clarke’s theme takes him through the gardens and courtyards of the Vatican to the rooms decorated for the Pope by Raphael and to the Sistine Chapel. Part 6. The theme of protest and communication leads Sir Kenneth to the Reformation, the Germany of Albrecht Durer and Martin Luther, to Erasmus, the France of Montaigne and to the Elizabethan England of Shakespeare.

results.title: The Herald newsreel
results.brief_description: One of the first sound films produced in Australia, this newsreel shows Joe Lyons, Prime Minister 1931-1939, and his Cabinet giving a message for Britain and the sister dominions, after swearing in at Government House. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Hen = La Gallina
results.brief_description: Shows the habits and behaviour of a flock of hens and roosters, and close-ups of their physical features. They are seen feeding, and their behaviour within a group is shown, including calling to each other and fighting. In Italian - no subtitles.

results.title: The Hela cell strain: cervical carcinoma
results.brief_description: Part of the Living Human Cells in Culture series. The film is introduced with a sequence of tissue preparation for photography, and then shows the physiological characteristics of Hela cells, a malignant strain of cervical origin. Among the processes shown are cell drinking, nuclear rotation, mitosis and the action of filapodia in intercellular communications.

results.title: The Heist
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Chris Rose Productions, Rose Productions, Home Box Office, Rick Rosenberg, Robert W. Christiansen and Stuart Orme
results.brief_description: Produced for television with teleplay by William Irish, Jr, “The Heist” is about revenge with an amusing twist. Neal Skinner (Pierce Brosnan), has served four years in prison for a robbery he did not commit. Believing he had been set up by his business partner, Ebet Berens (Tom Skerritt), he is out to even the score. Skinner finds himself even more determined to bring Berens down when he discovers that his partner has also moved in on his girlfriend Sheila (Wendy Hughes). It becomes a cat and mouse game as Skinner sets out to plan the ultimate heist - to rob the race track and set Berens up at the same time. This is a light-hearted film with a touch of the Remington Steele/James Bond feel played by the ever-suave and charmingly witty Pierce Brosnan in the main role. Cast also includes Noble Willingham, Tom Atkins, and Robert Prosky as Dancer.
